newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Alter says revising up 1997 net profit.
newsitem.headline: Alter says revising up 1997 net profit.

text.p: Indonesian kaolin miner PT Alter Abadi said on Monday it was revising up its 1997 net profit forecast following better-than-expected 1996 financial results.
"We are revising up this year's forecast after better-than-expected results in 1996," president director Rachman Hakim told a news conference.
Alter said in an earlier statement it posted a net profit of 36.86 billion rupiah in 1996 against 27.55 billion rupiah in 1995.
It said the 1996 net profit was 10.41 percent above forecasts. It did not give further details.
Hakim declined to give the new forecast, saying the firm was still calculating it.
The firm's current forecast for 1997 net sales was 163 billion rupiah and for 1997 net profit 41 billion rupiah.
Expected higher demand and firm prices both in the local and international markets for the firm's kaolin products were expected to further boost the firm's 1997 results, Hakim said.
Kaolin is used as raw material in the painting, paper, porcelain and soap industries.
